Package controllers

package controllers
The controllers package contains classes responsible for managing the user interface. Controllers play a crucial role in the application's architecture by facilitating the interaction between the user and the underlying system. They handle user input, process it, and coordinate the flow of data between the user interface, service layer, and view components.

The responsibilities of controllers include:

  1. Receiving user input.
  2. Performing basic validation and preprocessing of user input to ensure its correctness and consistency.
  3. Delegating the processed input to the appropriate service classes for further business logic execution.
  4. Receiving the results from the service classes and coordinating the presentation of data to the user interface.

Controllers act as intermediaries, decoupling the user interface from the underlying business logic to promote modularity, maintainability, and testability of the application.

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    AdminController
    The `AdminController` class is responsible for managing administrative tasks and operations.
    CustomerController
    The CustomerController class handles all customer interactions with the system, providing options to check order status, make new orders, and manage carts.
    LoginController
    Handles user authentication and post-login redirection based on user role.
    ManagerController
    Controller class for managing the user interface for branch managers.
    StaffController
    Handles staff operations such as viewing and processing orders.
    Welcome
    Prints the welcome screen and user role selection for the Fastfood ordering and management System (FOMS).
